What are the major challenges facing NSE's long-awaited IPO?
description: The NSE's long-awaited IPO faces continued delays due to unresolved regulatory concerns raised by Sebi, including the co-location case and technology infrastructure issues. Despite NSE's efforts to address these concerns and seek resolution through settlements, the IPO's future remains uncertain, pending Sebi's approval and the outcome of ongoing investigations. NSE is actively traded in the unlisted market.

title: Why is it the perfect time to invest in Nifty 200 Momentum 30 Index?
description: The Nifty 200 Momentum 30 Index has recently underperformed compared to the Nifty 50, potentially offering aggressive investors an opportunity for gradual investment. Experts suggest that this underperformance is temporary, and a systematic investment approach over the next 3-6 months could be beneficial as the market regains its rhythm.

title: How Leaders Should Really Use AI
description: Geoff Woods is the #1 international bestselling author of The AI-Driven Leader: Harnessing AI to Make Faster Decisions and the founder of AI Leadership and the AI Driven Leadership Collective. As a former Chief Growth Officer of a global company, Geoff brings real-world expertise in using AI to transform how leaders think and make decisions. In this episode, he reveals how AI can serve as a powerful thought partnerâ€”enhancing strategic focus, overcoming operational overwhelm, and unlocking breakthrough solutions using his CRIT framework. title: Why Balance Is a Lie for Entrepreneurs
description: Mike and Kass Lazerow are seasoned entrepreneurs and investors, best known for co-founding Golf.com and Buddy Mediaâ€”acquired by Salesforce for $745 million. They've backed nearly 100 early-stage startups, contributing to over $10 billion in realized gains. In this episode, they dive into the raw, often messy reality of entrepreneurship, sharing hard-earned lessons from their journey and their latest book. Listeners will gain powerful insights on thriving in uncertainty, embracing the grind, and building successful businesses and lives through focus, transparency, and relentless drive. title: Does the Tech Industry Need a Reboot?
description: AlthoughÂ weâ€™veÂ seen great successes come out of the technology sector in recent decades, many criticsÂ â€”Â and even some insidersÂ â€”Â say itâ€™s due for an overhaul. As a longtime Silicon Valley engineer and executive andÂ cofounder of the Grace Hopper Celebration of Women in Computing conference,Â Telle Whitney argues that tech culture is still too closed-off and unwelcoming to different points of view, which leads to products and services thatÂ arenâ€™tÂ as good as they could beÂ â€”Â for consumers and society. She thinks theÂ industryÂ â€”Â and corporate tech departmentsÂ â€”Â can stayÂ innovative while also becoming more inclusiveÂ andÂ shares herÂ advice for leaders who want to help.Â Whitney is the author of the new bookÂ Rebooting Tech Culture: How to Ignite Innovation and Build Organizations Where Everyone Can Thrive.

title: The Secrets Behind Barry Dillerâ€™s Business Success
description: To achieve long-term success in tumultuous businesses like media and entertainment, following formulas and data won't get you there. Barry Diller, the current Chairman and Senior Executive of both IAC and Expedia Group, has built a decades-long career in TV, film, and digital media by going with his instincts and betting on what he views as good ideas with limitless potential. He shares what he's learned about navigating the larger-than-life personalities in Hollywood, developing talent over time, and taking advantage of luck when it comes your way. Diller is the author of the new memoir,Â Who Knew.

title: Turf Wars, Tree Men & Murder: Inside the world of Christmas tree selling in NYC
description: Christmas trees are big business in NYC. Running a tree lot takes grit and experience, and even then, it's a tough network to break into. All of the lots in the city are divided into separate territories, owned by only a handful of entrepreneurs. We spent the day working for NYC's busiest Christmas tree seller on Greg Walsh's busiest day of the year to better understand the wild logistics behind NYCâ€™s Christmas tree economy and the tumultuous history of running a lot in this city. title: What does winning a James Beard Award really mean for chefs?
description: Often called the Oscars of the food industry, the James Beard Foundation Awards are among the most coveted for chefs in America. But what's sold and packaged as prestige can sometimes become a distraction from managing the business that got you there. Host Matt Brown is joined by The New York Times food critic Brett Anderson & chef Chintan Pandya (Dhamaka, Semma, Adda, Unapologetic Foods) to learn that an award can not only change a winner's life but an entire industry as a whole.

title: Tatcha: Vicky Tsai (July 2020)
description: In 2008, Vicky Tsai walked away from a startup job and set out to rediscover herself on a trip to Japan. In Kyoto, she had an unforgettable meeting with a geisha, and learned about the face creams and blotting papers that the traditional Japanese hostesses had used for centuries. But as she contemplated selling those products in the U.S., experts on both sides of the Pacific told her it would never work. Strapped for money and juggling multiple jobs, Vicky worked out of her parents' garage, pitching her new brandâ€”Tatchaâ€”on QVC and steadily growing it. In 2019, Unilever acquired Tatcha for a reported $500 million.This episode was produced by Jed Anderson with music composed by Ramtin Arablouei. It was edited by Neva Grant.You can follow HIBT onÂ XÂ &Â Instagram, and email us at hibt@id.wondery.com.
